alert.note: Alert for Cochise (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Advisory issued September 12 at 4:06PM MST until September 12 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Dust Advisory for... North central Cochise County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 500 PM MST. * At 405 PM MST, areas of blowing dust ahead of a group of strong to severe thunderstorms along I-10 between Willcox and the New Mexico border. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 328 and 373. Route 186 between mile markers 327 and 337. Route 191 between mile markers 65 and 90. Locations impacted include... Willcox and Bowie. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
